title: EastEnders spoilers: Whitney devastated as Leo reveals Callum's secret
text:
Callum ‘Halfway’ Highway (Tony Clay) has been getting along rather nicely with ex Whitney Dean (Shona McGarty) in EastEnders as of late, but evil Leo King (Tom Wells) set about ruining their special bond in tonight’s episode and, unfortunately, it would appear as if he accomplished to do so, as he set a trap to ruin Callum’s good name — and it’s one that Whitney walked right into.

After it became rather clear that Whitney was still harbouring feelings for Callum, Leo knew the young man was going to be a thorn in his side, and thus he set about removing him from the equation so that he can carry on his plan to get close to Whitney.

Earlier this week, the paralegal made himself out to be a hero when he aided Whitney in cleaning up her stall after it was vandalised. However, afterwards, Callum came along and offered his assistance — and Leo was fuming as the pair hugged once more.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Tonight, he decided to put his mission to dirty Callum’s name into play, and it came to light that he’d acquired an old video of Callum from his army days — and he set about orchestrating a way for Whitney to come across said video on his laptop.

After buying Callum a drink, Leo asked him about his experiences in the army. Whitney and Lola (Danielle Harold) arrived, and Leo made clear his intention to help Whitney find out the truth about who vandalised her stall.

While sitting with Leo, Whitney noticed a file on his laptop named ‘Callum Highway.’ Curiosity got the better of her, and she checked out the clip — and was horrified by what she saw.

During the clip, Callum was in the presence of several men — all of whom were mocking and jeering a drunk woman. They proceeded to make comments about stripping her, and Callum attempted to talk the thugs out of it.

In the Queen Vic, Callum approached Whitney to see what she was watching, and the young woman wasted little time in letting out her frustrations over what she’d just witnessed.

A shocked Callum made every effort to explain how he didn’t take part in the jeering — not to mention how he attempted to stop the awful behaviour his so-called mates were carrying out — but Whitney was having none of it, and accused him of holding back out of fear that his mates would find out that he’s gay.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Callum was devastated, and thus left the Vic, knowing that he could say little to change Whitney’s opinion of him. Leo’s plan had worked.

Has Whitney turned her back on Callum for good? Or will she give him a chance to explain himself?

What’s more, the fact that Leo’s popped up at every given opportunity is certainly odd to say the least — not to mention the fact that he was investigating Callum too — so perhaps Whitney will come to discover the truth?

EastEnders continues Friday 25thOctober at 8pm on BBC One.

MORE: EastEnders spoilers: A dark new storyline is revealed for Ben Mitchell as he takes revenge

Advertisement Advertisement
description: Knowing Callum would prove a problem, Leo set out to muddy his name and change Whitney's opinion of him — and he succeeded in doing so.
